oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. James Missionary Baptist Church, circa 2001
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of St. James Missionary Baptist Church located at 600 Twenty-eighth Avenue in Nashville, Tennessee. According to the cornerstone the church was founded in 1925 under Reverend H.W. Turner and renovated in 1973 under Reverend D.L. Williams, Jr. The foundation is made of stone blocks. The exterior walls of the front facade are brick. The body of the church has walls made of dressed stone. The rear addition walls are composed of cinderblocks. The gabled roof is composed of shingles. The four front doors are wooden. Additional features include a covered porch and seven stained glass windows on each side of the main building. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: St. James Missionary Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
